page.title: 12'THE CAULD LAD OF HYLTON'
page.content: Legend says Hylton Castle is haunted by the troubled spirit of Roger Skelton, employed as a stable boy at the turn of the 16th Century. The baron of Hylton had instructed the lad to have his horse ready for an early morning gallop. Roger failed to do this. Furiously the Baron strode into the stables to discover the boy curled up asleep in the hay. The Baron angrily snatched up a hay fork and flung it at the lad killing him instantly. The Baron disposed of the corpse in a nearby pond. The ghost of Roger Skelton returned nightly, full of mischief. If the kitchen was in order, he would soon have pots and pans flying around. If everything was disorderly he would tidy it up.Eventually the remains of Roger were buried in hallowed ground.
